question: when did the great plague of london start and end
api_result: The Great Plague of London began in 1665 and ended in 1666. It was part of the larger outbreak of the bubonic plague that affected England and Europe during that time. The plague resulted in the deaths of an estimated 100,000 people in London, which was about a quarter of the city's population at the time. The outbreak is often considered the last major epidemic of the bubonic plague in England.
